Hey folks, Rakudai Kishi no Cavalry is a battle harem that is slightly better than the others that have come out this season. It's a better version of Gakusen Toshi Asterisk but a worse version of Mahouka Koukou no Rettousei.  
    Our story begins with the start of a school year and our male MC(Ikki Kurogane) is walking into his room, alas what does he find in his room? What many of us would like to find, a pretty girl, with the added bonus that she is changing clothes. Sounds familiar to Asterisk? Of course the girlis the female MC(Stella Vermillion), and she is indeed a fire wielding Tsundere. Now our male MC is much better at presenting a more like able personality here so he gains a few points, though the end result is the same that these two characters must duel to decide who gets to make the rules for the room. Ikki is the weakest student in the school supposedly with no magical talent, whereas Stella is one of the more strong first years with incredible magical power. Ikki however wins the duel by using his "Non-magical ability" which allows him to go past his own ability for a short amount of time, and wins the rights to the room.


    Having picked this up right after Asterisk, I found it amusing that it started in almost identical manners. I however decided that Ikki had won me over with his quick decision to also take off his clothes to make things even for seeing Stella changing. The story goes on and we learn about the school, what this magic ability really is and more importantly what Ikki must do to graduate. We don't get much in the way of world development and have little knowledge of the school, the people that run the school and the magical community on the outside and what it means to be a magical knight. This didn't really affect the show however, it was clear early on that the rest of the world didn't matter and we were only here to watch to see if Ikki could graduate. The shows pacing was ok, though a little fast and shallow. We do get to see a decent amount of character development and the relationship, though quickly formed, seemed reasonably well thought out.


    The latter half of the series went by much the same as the first though the last two episodes almost went and shattered the more relaxed former episodes work by being more serious. The ending was a little anti climatic however the relationship that in many harems seems to never complete, managed to end in a satisfying way. A second season would be welcome and I would like to see more of the other characters and the world that these so called magic knights are training to enter.


    The characters are fairly well done. There isn't many, but the ones that are in the story all have solid personalities rooted in a backstory. There isn't many cringy situations, and the situations that are more hit or miss with people like the incest connotations are well spoken and have a backstory that other anime don't include. I would have liked a more diverse list of characters or at least more camera time for the ones that are in the story because Ikki and Stella take most of the show. Ikki basically is Tatsuya from Rettousei(Though IMO not as cool. I'm a fan of our lord Shiba Tatsuya). He is at the bottom of the school because of the way that he was being scored. Stella is one of the better Tsundere's, though this is because shes more Dere and less Tsun and this again is to my preference.  


    The art is fine, pretty standard for this season of anime. The fight scenes were well done and the effects for each magic ability were pretty cool and interesting. The sound effects were fitting. The music at the end was pretty good, Asterisk however wins out here.


    Overall I really enjoyed the show. Didn't have a problem finishing all 12 episodes. It ended well enough even if it was a little anti climatic. The story built itself well, but it isn't a masterpiece. If your looking to find a decent harem this season give this one a shot. It deserves it more than the others I've watched recently.

First off I definitely did not expect Rakudai Kishi no Cavalry t be this good. Just judging by the little I had read and the way it seemed it was going to go. I expected the usual new battle/harem/romance anime. Which usually consists of great art, good music,good fight animations and a weak to average story with normally average charries......I was wrong
It delivered in all the areas that I was already expecting with great art and fights. It then however came through with a pretty darn good story/backstory as well as very good and likable charries even the sides. Even fairly original and un commonwith Alice. Of course some things where shortened and so on but you can really tell how well written the story is from the light novels. The backstory and all of the charries storys is where it really shines. Looking at the plot bio you would think it's going to be a typical battle tourny anime but it's not.  I love though that while being different and having a much better written story and more in depth than the usual type from this genre it still also delivered on all the points you would be expecting from the usual ones. It also surprisingly does a better job with the romance aspect than even most "romance" anime do. It's not to obviously rushed and the mcs relationship actually progresses instead of having awkward nothings happen all show then the last episode maybe having a confession or kiss.


I don't really like to rate anime on very technical aspects. I like to go more by how much I enjoyed and got into them but I will touch on some things briefly. Obviously with most newer anime unless your just into the very old anime art styles the art is great and the battle animations are very well done. The music is solid through out and is great in episode 12. Something it done fairly well that is a huge thing most anime fail at these days was pacing. If you want to be very picky you could say it was a slight bit rushed maybe but honestly it's very well paced for a 12 episode battle anime with all that it covered and covered pretty well. I also enjoyed this anime alot. To my surprise I enjoyed it more than I have an anime in a while especially of this genre.  


If there is one bad point for Rakudai Kishi no Cavalry though I would have to say there is a bit to much fan service. I am not one for it and really could do without it period so that may be just me but if I had to pick at something that is it. It's not to bad but there are points where it seemed a bit to much to me though even with this being someone who dislikes fan service it was down in a sort of cute way and a big thing with me a way that didn't break story or make the charries seem stupid/to pervy/out of character. Also obviously with the show being made from a light novel series the ending leaves alot of things your going to want to see. It doesn't end badly however just leaves you wanting more which is the point I suppose being that most of these anime are made to promote source materiel and they did that very well. I haven't even touched the light novels and can pretty much see an idea of where it goes from where the anime left off and would love to see it. Just kind of annoying for those anime watchers out there who don't also read light novels. There usually isn't a season 2 for this sort of promotion anime but hopefully there will be.


Overall I give Rakudai Kishi no Cavalry a 8.5 and could easily give it a 9 if they laid off the fan service just a bit. I would also probably go up a bit if the way they did the ending wasn't so obvious that it was made pretty much solely to promote the light novels. I get it and understand but being someone that is not really into lns and mainly being into anime it get's a bit frustrating knowing all this anime are pretty much made with intent in mind of having no second season unless it just completely blows up like an SAO or Tokyo Ghoul  and was just made to get Japanese to buy the lns. Being an american anime fan really is s struggle sometimes lololol. Definitely recommend watching though!

Well, the battles arent as those in One Piece, or Fairy Tail, HxH, just a cut bellow, but thats what you can expect from 12 episode anime. They gave me the same thrill, excitement and sitting-on-the-edge filling. The comedy is not some mainstream cliche bullshit, but instead something that can really make you laugh. The anime is not harem. I could say, that would be in my top 5, no 3, romances. It had one of the most sweet, uninterrupted and non harem moments, which are modern now. 


Art 10/10. The art... it was awesome. It wasnt something I'd notice, it fit perfectly the anime. It features some pretty bad-ass fights, cute girls with bikini and characters. Like who wouldnt like the Sword Eater? Also something worth to note: The ecchi in this anime, is not what you get in ecchi animes - like boobs all over the place, everywhere and thrown at your face at any time. It is done masterfully, just the right bit, not to annoy you, but to impress you, or make you laugh. 


Sound 10/10. Same as the art. Although it isnt like I'd get impressed with a song, and try to find it and listen it every now and then, but it fit the setting really good. 


Characters 10/10. The anime develops the characters pretty well in my opinion. It really shows their feelings, and makes them reasonable. Its not like we have seen in some shit animes: there is a conflict, this is it, let the character cry a bit - done. It actually digs in it, its not straightforward.


Enjoyment 10/10. All I need to say is, that I have watched this show in like 4 hours. It was awesome. Like I feel I had really good time. That I have watched in all times. I had those cute moments, laughter, despair (you know, when you want just to turn off the show or skip it) and epicness. I feel there is nothing more I could have wanted.


Overall 10/10. This show is as the main character itself. Its not 'born' with some really great setting, or original plot idea. Its all how it was executed. Perfectly. It was a perfect mixture of what you'd want, the right amount of everything. As I said: Cute romance moments (not annoyingly interrupted, that make you wanna crash the screen), great humor and ecchi even. Achieving the balance, that make you breeze over the show, while trembling with excitement  is what makes an anime a masterpiece. And this is indeed one. Thanks for reading & hopefully enjoyable watching!
